alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 12:17PM MST until January 20 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts across high terrain areas. In Zion National Park, 1 to 3 inches expected below 4000 feet elevation and 3 to 6 inches above 4000 feet elevation. * WHERE...Zion National Park, South Central Utah and Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Periods of winter driving conditions will occur. For those planning outdoor recreation, prepare for cold and snowy conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
